questions.prompt: What is the first step in Gaussian elimination?
questions.explanation: Gaussian elimination begins by writing the system as an augmented matrix, which combines the coefficient matrix and the constant vector.

questions.prompt: A system of linear equations can have exactly two solutions.
questions.explanation: False. A linear system can have exactly one solution (consistent and independent), infinitely many solutions (consistent and dependent), or no solution (inconsistent). It cannot have exactly two solutions.

questions.prompt: What does it mean for a system to be in row echelon form?
options: All zeros are at the bottom
Leading entries move to the right in successive rows
All entries below leading entries are zero
questions.explanation: Row echelon form requires: (1) all zero rows at the bottom, (2) the leading entry of each row is to the right of the leading entry above it, and (3) all entries below a leading entry are zero.

questions.prompt: A homogeneous system of linear equations always has at least:
questions.explanation: A homogeneous system (where all constants are zero) always has at least the trivial solution (all variables equal zero).

questions.prompt: The matrix equation $Ax = b$ represents a system of ____ equations.
questions.explanation: The matrix equation $Ax = b$ is the compact form of a system of linear equations.

questions.prompt: If an augmented matrix row reduces to $[0 \; 0 \; 0 \; | \; 5]$, the system is:
questions.explanation: The row $[0 \; 0 \; 0 \; | \; 5]$ represents $0 = 5$, which is impossible. Therefore the system is inconsistent (has no solution).

questions.prompt: Which operation is NOT an elementary row operation?
options: Multiply a row by a nonzero scalar
Add a multiple of one row to another
Add two rows together and replace both
questions.explanation: The three elementary row operations are: (1) swap rows, (2) multiply a row by a nonzero scalar, and (3) add a multiple of one row to another row. We never replace both rows.

questions.prompt: Reduced row echelon form (RREF) of a matrix is unique.
questions.explanation: True. Every matrix has exactly one reduced row echelon form, though there are many possible row echelon forms.

questions.prompt: A system with more equations than unknowns is called:
questions.explanation: An overdetermined system has more equations than unknowns. Such systems are often inconsistent unless there is redundancy.

questions.prompt: In RREF, the leading entry in each row is ____ and is the only nonzero entry in its column.
questions.explanation: In reduced row echelon form, each leading entry (pivot) is 1, and it is the only nonzero entry in its column.

questions.prompt: If a homogeneous system has more unknowns than equations, it must have:
questions.explanation: When a homogeneous system has more variables than equations, there are free variables, guaranteeing infinitely many solutions beyond the trivial solution.

questions.prompt: The solution set of a consistent nonhomogeneous system $Ax = b$ can be written as:
options: $x = p$ where $p$ is a particular solution
$x = p + v_h$ where $p$ is particular and $v_h$ is from homogeneous
questions.explanation: The general solution is $x = p + v_h$ where $p$ is any particular solution to $Ax = b$ and $v_h$ is the general solution to the homogeneous system $Ax = 0$.

questions.prompt: If $Ax = b$ is consistent for every vector $b$, then $A$ must be square.
questions.explanation: False. For $Ax = b$ to be consistent for every $b$, $A$ must have full row rank (columns span $\mathbb{R}^m$). This requires at least as many columns as rows, so $A$ could be wide (more columns than rows) or square, but not tall. A tall matrix cannot span all possible $b$ vectors.

questions.prompt: The equation $Ax = 0$ has only the trivial solution if and only if:
options: The columns of $A$ are linearly independent
The columns of $A$ are linearly dependent
questions.explanation: The homogeneous equation $Ax = 0$ has only the trivial solution if and only if the columns of $A$ are linearly independent.

questions.prompt: A variable that is not a leading variable in RREF is called a ____ variable.
questions.explanation: Free variables correspond to columns without pivots and can take any value, generating infinitely many solutions.
